title: Russia Unleashes Largest Drone Attack on Ukrainian Capital Ahead of Kyiv Day
description: An explosion of a drone in the sky over the city during a Russian drone strike in Kyiv, Ukraine, on May 28, 2023. (Gleb Garanich/Reuters)

title: Aussie State Government Rejects Calls to End No-Grounds Rental Evictions
description: A ‘For Rent’ and a ‘For Sale’ sign is seen in Canberra, Australia on Feb. 27, 2023. (AAP Image/Lukas Coch)

title: ANALYSIS: G-7 Leaders Take Strong Stance on China, but Can They Maintain Their Resolve?
description: (L to R) U.S. President Joe Biden, Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz, Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, European Council President Charles Michel, France's President Emmanuel Macron, Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, and Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau take part in a working lunch session as part of the G-7 Leaders' Summit in Hiroshima, Japan, on May 19, 2023. (Ludovic Marin/AFP via Getty Images)

title: 96-Year-Old Ottawa Woman Sets World Record for 5-Kilometre Race
description: Ninety-six-year-old Rejeanne Fairhead (L), seen in this handout image, says that until two years ago, the most athletic things she had ever done involved bowling and horse shoes. (The Canadian Press/Ho-Tamarack Ottawa Race Weekend)

title: Both Alberta Premier Contenders on Last-Minute Campaign Stops
description: NDP Leader Rachel Notley (L) and UCP Leader Danielle Smith shake hands before a debate in Edmonton on May 18, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Jason Franson)

title: Turkey’s Erdogan Secures 5 More Years in Tight Presidential Election
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan casts his vote in Turkey's general elections at a polling station in the Uskudar district, in Istanbul, Turkey, on May 14, 2023. (Umit Bektas-Pool/Getty Images)

title: EU Issues Warning After Elon Musk Pulls Twitter Out of Anti-‘Disinformation’ Agreement
description: Elon Musk speaks at the 2020 Satellite Conference and Exhibition in Washington, D.C., on March 9, 2020. (Win McNamee/Getty Images)

title: Labour Vows to Curb Hiring of Foreign Workers, Focus More on UK Talent
description: Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer delivers a speech at the office of UK Finance in central London, on Feb. 27, 2023. (Stefan Rousseau/PA Media)

title: Police Arrest Fourth Suspect in Unsolved Kidnapping of Ontario Woman
description: Elnaz Hajtamari of Toronto has been missing since Jan. 12, 2022. (Ontario Province Police Handout)

title: Hamilton Couple Embroiled in Landlord-Tenant Dispute Shot Dead While Fleeing

title: South Korean Arrested for Opening Plane Emergency Exit Door, Faces up to 10 Years in Prison
description: A man who opened an emergency exit door during a flight, arrives to attend an arrest warrant review at the Daegu District Court in Daegu, South Korea, on May 28, 2023. (Yun Kwan-shick/Yonhap via AP)

title: Home Office Launches Ad Campaign to Deter Albanians From Illegal Channel Crossings
description: A group of illegal immigrants are brought by a Border Force vessel to Dover, Kent, on May 19, 2023. (Gareth Fuller/PA Media)

title: Man Who Opened Asiana Plane Door in Mid-Air Tells Police He Was ‘Uncomfortable’
description: Asiana Airlines' Airbus A321 plane, of which a passenger opened a door on a flight shortly before the aircraft landed, is pictured at an airport in Daegu, South Korea, on May 26, 2023. (Yonhap via Reuters)

title: Opposing Advice From Australia’s RBA Governor ‘Deliberately’ Leaked to Damage Government: Minister
description: Patrick Gorman, assistant minister to the Australian prime minister, speaks to media during a press conference after a visit to North Metropolitan TAFE in Perth, Western Australia, on Feb. 20, 2023. (AAP Image/Richard Wainwright)

title: Chinese Ships Ignore Vietnam’s Demand to Leave Area Close to Russian-Run Gas Fields
description: A Chinese coast guard ship patrols Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea on Dec. 25, 2022. (STR/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Community Mourns 4 Killed in Regional Victoria Crash
description: A tree is seen at the a crash scene on Old Melbourne Road in Millbrook north-west of Melbourne, on Sept. 10, 2019. (AAP Image/Julian Smith)

title: Comedian Arrested in Beijing as Informants Become Norm Again in China, Eroding Mutual Trust

title: Chinese Military Drills Around Japan Before G-7, Triggering Strong Reaction From Japanese

title: Mexican Authorities Make Arrest in Mid-May Killing of Quebec Man in Seaside Town

title: Trans Tyranny: The Battle For Human Nature
Firefighters Stamp out Montreal Heritage Building Blaze 42 Hours After It Ignited

title: Pair Charged as $60 Million in Cocaine Found at Sydney Port
